intro: Cyrtandra pedicellata, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs. Cyrtandra pedicellata is adapted to the moist, shaded environments of Hawaii's rainforests.
